intro: Hapalocarpum indicum, commonly known as the Indian fiddlehead, is a herbaceous plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its fruits are small, dry, and schizocarpic, splitting into two one-seeded parts upon maturity. Hapalocarpum indicum is often found in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
